questions.text: You are physically attracted to this person.
You respect them as a person.
You would be embarrassed if your friends met them.
This person does something you are morally against (e.g., cheating, lying, shoplifting).
You have survived a minor inconvenience together (e.g., flight delay, IKEA trip) without fighting.
This person has ever made you feel small on purpose.
You admire how this person spends their time.
You secretly resent how they spend their time.
You enjoy doing nothing together with this person.
You feel this person gets your sense of humor (you think they are funny/they think you are funny).
You would be okay being stuck in an airport with them for 10 hours.
They can admit when they are wrong about something.
You can usually understand the other person's side in an argument.
When you fight, it feels like a competition.
When you fight, it feels like collaboration.
This person talks over you when you are saying something or arguing.
You feel you can disagree in a level-headed way.
You walk away from arguments feeling dismissed.
You can laugh about your disagreements afterwards.
They can take feedback or criticism without turning it into an argument.
You leave conversations feeling understood.
They have shown they can apologize AND actually change their behavior (not just say sorry).
You trust them even when they are out of sight.
You check their online activity when you are anxious or don't know where they are.
You've considered hiding your true feelings so as not to scare this person off.
This person remembers small details/things you said days ago.
This person shows interest in your world (friends, passions, hobbies).
They avoid emotional topics or shut down when you discuss something serious.
You feel emotionally seen by this person.
You feel emotionally analyzed by this person.
You feel like you can be vulnerable with this person.
You've thought about hiding parts of your life so they won't judge you.
You feel you don't need to prove your worth for them to like/respect you.
This person shows up when it matters, not just when it's convenient.
You feel like you are competing for their attention.
You have felt calmer since dating/being with them.
You have stopped doing self-destructive things since dating them.
You have started doing self-destructive things since dating them.
This person takes care of you when you are sick.
You genuinely look forward to seeing this person.
When something good happens, they are the first person you want to tell.
You have directly opposing views on health and exercise.
You have directly opposing views on where to live.
You have directly opposing views on finances and career (e.g., saver vs. spender).
You have directly opposing life goals and dreams (e.g., stability vs. adventure).
Your day-to-day routines don't match up (e.g., tidy vs. messy, early bird vs. nocturnal).
You have directly opposing views on religion or spirituality.
You have directly opposing views on having kids.
You've imagined introducing them to your parents and felt dread.
Their lifestyle constantly drains your energy or money.
Your friends don't like this person.
You find yourself having to defend this person to family or friends.
You can picture yourself growing old with this person.
You can accept their flaws and are okay if they never change.
This person acts like your time is less valuable than theirs.
This person makes you laugh in a way that no one else does.

results.label: EXTREMELY HEALTHY
results.description: You are likely with your soulmate. You feel safe, respected, and understood. No major unresolved issues.

results.label: HEALTHY / SOLID
results.description: You communicate well, are aligned on important things, and you like who you are with them.

results.label: PRETTY GOOD
results.description: Mostly positive but with some friction. Not perfect, but not unstable. Can be long-term if both put in effort.

results.label: NEUTRAL / UNCLEAR
results.description: Connection exists but there are noticeable issues. Could go either way depending on honesty and effort. Not thriving, but not immediate danger.

results.label: NOT GREAT
results.description: You are compromising more than you realize. Issues exist that will likely continue to bother you. Not a disaster yet, but not looking good.

results.label: PROBLEMATIC
results.description: Repeated patterns of resentment, mismatched values, or emotional instability. The relationship drains more than it gives.

results.label: BAD
results.description: You are likely unhappy but have normalized it. You are trying to make it work even though it doesn't meet your needs.

results.label: VERY BAD
results.description: Affecting your self-esteem, habits, and health. You may be staying out of fear or guilt, but you are not compatible long-term.

results.label: LEAVE IMMEDIATELY
results.description: Objectively harmful. Your needs and well-being are ignored. Unlikely to be fixable.
